intro: Paepalanthus karstenii var. corei, commonly known as the core's cholla, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with reduced leaves and thick, fleshy stems for water storage. It typically grows in dry forests and grasslands, showcasing a unique combination of structural and physiological adaptations to its harsh habitat. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some regions, though it remains primarily a wild species.
